item.title: Making an npc shoot a projectile
item.dc:creator: @For For ( ; ; )
item.description:
@For wrote:

It would be like …

createProjectile(npcsY, npcsX, offsetY, offsetX, 50, 85, ###, 30, 30, playerId)

For offset you would have to reverse it so it would be

offsetX = (npcsX - absX) * -1; offsetY = (npcsY - absY) * -1;

item.title: Making an npc shoot a projectile
item.dc:creator: @For For ( ; ; )
item.description:
@For wrote:

In the AttackPlayerMage method in NpcHandler class you can add it so they attack with projectiles.

Do something like…

if(npcs[i].npcType == ####) { npcs[i].animNumber = ####; // anim of the npc client1.createProjectile(//shit here); // just make it reverse the projectile it's not hard to figure out, make it like you're going to create a normal projectile and switch your absX and absY with the npcs and visa versa k1 = ####; // hitdiff } }

item.source: Making an npc shoot a projectile

item.title: Making an npc shoot a projectile
item.dc:creator: @xx_qwertyuiop_xx xx qwertyuiop xx
item.description:
@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

Ok, normally createProjectile would contain the following:

    public void createProjectile(int casterY, int casterX, int offsetY, int offsetX, int angle, int speed, int gfxMoving,
                int startHeight, int endHeight, int lockon) {
                outStream.createFrame(85);
                outStream.writeByteC((casterY - (mapRegionY * 8)) - 2);
                outStream.writeByteC((casterX - (mapRegionX * 8)) - 3);
                outStream.createFrame(117);
                outStream.writeByte(angle);                     //Starting place of the projectile
                outStream.writeByte(offsetY);               //Distance between caster and enemy Y
                outStream.writeByte(offsetX);                //Distance between caster and enemy X
                outStream.writeWord(lockon);        //The NPC the missle is locked on to
                outStream.writeWord(gfxMoving);             //The moving graphic ID
                outStream.writeByte(startHeight);           //The starting height
                outStream.writeByte(endHeight);             //Destination height
                outStream.writeWord(51);                        //Time the missle is created
                outStream.writeWord(speed);                     //Speed minus the distance making it set
                outStream.writeByte(16);                        //Initial slope
                outStream.writeByte(64);                        //Initial distance from source (in the direction of the missile) //64    
    }

Notice how lockon is being written as a positive integer? If it were written negatively, it would lock onto a player.
So you could make an identical method with the exception of lockon being written as -lockon.

Read full topic
item.source: Making an npc shoot a projectile

item.title: Making an npc shoot a projectile
item.dc:creator: @xx_qwertyuiop_xx xx qwertyuiop xx
item.description:
@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

I found it. When maging NPCs it uses writeword(-lockOn).
If you want it to shoot from NPC to player, use writeword(lockOn).

Edit: You could make a separate method for that, or just use a boolean for maging NPCs.
It wouldn’t let me edit my post so I had to delete my post and repost it.

Read full topic
